FFd20.title: Pathfinder 1
FFd20.description: A comprehensive game system for running games of Pathfinder 1 in the Foundry VTT environment.
SETTINGS.FFd20DiagL: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.FFd20InitTiebreakerH: Append total initiative divided by 100 to break ties in Initiative.
SETTINGS.FFd20ExpRateL: The rate at which characters advance in levels
SETTINGS.FFd20NoExpL: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
SETTINGS.FFd20OpenXPDistributorL: Opens the XP distributor on combat end unless Shift is held when the combat's deletion is confirmed
SETTINGS.FFd20BackgroundSkillsH: Use the Background Skills optional ruleset
SETTINGS.FFd20FractionalBaseBonusesH: Use the Fractional Base Bonuses optional ruleset
SETTINGS.FFd20PCWoundsAndVigorH: Use the Wounds and Vigor optional ruleset for player characters.
SETTINGS.FFd20NPCWoundsAndVigorH: Use the Wounds and Vigor optional ruleset for nonplayer characters.
SETTINGS.FFd20AutoCollapseCardL: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
SETTINGS.FFd20MeasureStyleL: Whether to use Pathfinder's measurement style instead of FoundryVTT's default style
SETTINGS.FFd20LowLightVisionModeH: When checked, players who have no token selected will not benefit from any of their tokens' low-light vision (this also applies to darkvision)
SETTINGS.FFd20SharedVisionModeH: How to handle Shared Vision between players.
SETTINGS.FFd20AllowScriptChangesH: Allows the use of "Script"-type changes in the world
SETTINGS.FFd20AllowScriptChangesW:
This settings would allow players to execute arbitrary code as the GM.

Are you absolutely sure you want to enable this?
SETTINGS.FFd20AllowScriptChangesE: Script Changes are disabled on this world.
SETTINGS.FFd20HideTokenConditionsH: Whether buffs should hide their icons from token status effects
SETTINGS.FFd20obscureInlineRollsH: Hide inline rolls from those without at least observer permission.
SETTINGS.FFd20obscureSaveDCsH: Hide DC values from chat cards from players.
SETTINGS.FFd20CoreEffectsH: Displays only FFd20 conditions on tokens (unchecked) or core icons as well (checked)
SETTINGS.FFd20HideChatButtonsH: Whether to hide chat card buttons, such as those found on attack rolls.
SETTINGS.FFd20AttackChatCardTemplateH: Select the style of attack type chat cards
SETTINGS.FFd20UnchainedActionEconomyH: Whether to use the Unchained Action Economy optional ruleset.
SETTINGS.FFd20SkipActionDialogsH: Skips action prompts (such as those from attacks and saving throws) unless you Shift-click them
SETTINGS.placeMeasureTemplateOnQuickRoll: Enables the placement of measure templates when skipping the action prompt.
SETTINGS.FFd20InvertSectionFilterBehavio: Inverts shift-click behaviour on type filters in (item) sections.
SETTINGS.FFd20HideReachMeasurementsH: Don't show reach measurements, such as those found when hovering over token quick actions.
SETTINGS.FFd20DisplayIterativesH: Breaks down BAB display to iteratives instead of only the total bonus
SETTINGS.FFd20AlternativeReachCornerRule: Hides the outer corners from 10-ft reach measurements
SETTINGS.FFd20DisableAttackCardTargetsH: Disables targeted actors from showing up on attack cards
SETTINGS.FFd20ClearTargetsAfterAttackH: Whether to untarget everything after an attack roll.
SETTINGS.FFd20HealthConfigInstructions: Configure the health computation parameters for the various types of actors.  For reference, Pathfinder Society uses the following configuration for player characters: automatic computation, 0.5 rate, one hitdie maximized, round up, discrete continuity.
SETTINGS.FFd20HealthRoundingHint: Health values must be whole numbers.  Round up, nearest, or down?
SETTINGS.FFd20HealthContinuityHint: Health can be computed discretely or continuously.  Discrete health is rounded at each level, meaning creatures will receive a stable amount of health for each hitdie.  Continuous health is rounded after each source of hitdie is evaluated, meaning creatures will receive a fluctuating amount of health for each hitdie.
SETTINGS.FFd20HealthConfigWoundsAndVigor: Use the Wounds and Vigor optional ruleset for player characters.
Use the Wounds and Vigor optional ruleset for nonplayer characters.
SETTINGS.FFd20HealthConfigWoundsThreshol: Use wound threshold optional ruleset for player characters.
Use wound threshold optional rulset for nonplayer characters.
SETTINGS.FFd20HealthConfigWoundThreshold: Allow wound threshold override for PCs
Allows per character override modification of wound threshold rule for player characters in character settings.
Allow wound threshold override for NPCs
Allows per character override modification of wound threshold rule for nonplayer characters in character settings.
SETTINGS.FFd20DragRulerUseElevationName: Use elevation to determine movement type
SETTINGS.FFd20DragRulerUseElevationHint: Use a tokens elevation to determine wether a token is flying or burrowing

HideTokenTooltip.Name: Hide Token Tooltip
HideTokenTooltip.Hint: Hide token tooltips while this key is held

ForceShowItem.Name: Force Show Item
ForceShowItem.Hint: Whether to show the item to chat when using a macro for it

SETTINGS.FFd20UnitsL: System of units to be used in the world
SETTINGS.FFd20DistanceUnitsL: Override system of units to be used with distances.
SETTINGS.FFd20WeightUnitsL: Override system of units to be used with weights.
FFd20.AccessibilityFontSizeHint: Changes font size in certain aspects of the game (such as on attack chat cards)
FFd20.TooltipWorldConfigHideHeld_Hint: Hide Held items from all players
FFd20.TooltipWorldConfigHideActorName_Hi: Hide Actor names from all players

Roll.Desc: Your hit points for this level will be rolled for based on the size of your hit die.

Manual.Desc: You will decide how many hit points you gain for this level.

HP.Desc: You will gain a single hit point as your favoured class bonus for this level.

Skill.Desc: You will gain a single skill rank to freely spend as your favoured class bonus for this level.

Alt.Desc: You will gain something specific for your class and race combination as your favoured class bonus for this level.

Item.Name: Added Ability Scores
Item.Desc: This feature is used for tracking your ability score changes from gaining hit die.

Extra.NewFeat: You have 1 new feat to choose
Extra.NewFeats: You have {newValue} new feats to choose
Extra.NewAbilityScore: You can increase an ability score by +1

FFd20.FlagsInstructions: Configure character features and traits which fine-tune behaviors of the FFd20 system.
FFd20.PointBuyCalculatorWarning: The point buy calculator will OVERRIDE the character's base ability scores.
FFd20.LinkHelpChildren: Linked children are deleted from the actor when the link parent (this item) is deleted.
FFd20.LinkHelpCharges: Linked items inherit and share the charges from the link parent (this item).
FFd20.LinkHelpClassAssociations: Class association linked items are automatically added to the actor at the appropriate class level. Unlike other item links, these must be linked from a compendium.
FFd20.LinkHelpAmmunition: Linked items automatically lose quantity (or charge) for every attack made with link parent (this item).
FFd20.HelpSellMultiplier: The rate at which non-trade goods sell. Trade goods always sell at full price. Default is 0.5.
FFd20.HelpDomainSpell: This spell will not cost any spell slots to restore upon rest.
FFd20.CurrencyGMRequired: A GM is required to finish the transfer.
FFd20.ItemContainerTotalItemValue: Total Item Value: {0} GP, {1} SP, {2} CP

FFd20.AutoSpellClassLevelOffset.InfoBox: If you have a prestige class that alters your class level, add that here (e.g. @classes.mysticTheurge.level)

FFd20.SpellScoreTooLow: Your ability score is too low to cast spells of this level
FFd20.ErrorGenericPermission: You don't have permission to perform what action
FFd20.ErrorNoActorPermission: You don't have permission to control this actor
FFd20.ErrorNoActorPermissionAlt: You don't have permission to control actor '{0}'

FFd20.ErrorItemFormula: There's a formula error in item {0} on actor {1}

FFd20.ErrorNoApplicableActorFoundForActi: No applicable actor found for action '{0}'
FFd20.ErrorCouldNotFindActorByName: Could not find actor by name '{0}'
FFd20.ErrorNoMacroID: No macro with id '{id}' was found
FFd20.WarningNoSizeDie: Could not determine size-appropriate die for {0}, defaulting to rolling {1}
FFd20.WarningNoDiceAllowedInFormula: No dice rolls are allowed in formula '{0}' for {1}
FFd20.WarningInsufficientAmmunition: You have insufficient ammunition of type {0}
FFd20.WarningMissingAmmunition: Ammunition linked to the attack is missing.
FFd20.WarningConditionalRoll: Rolling conditional formula â„– {number} of conditional {name} caused an error
FFd20.WarningCannotCreateChargeLink: Could not create a Charge type link between {0} and {1}, because {1} has Charge type links of its own
FFd20.WarningCannotCreateChargeLink2: Could not create a Charge type link between {0} and {1}, because {1} is already linked to {2}

Drag and drop from {0}
or click the '+ Add' button above.
FFd20.Info_MissingClass: Your character is missing a class. Go to the Classes subtab on the Summary tab of your character sheet.
FFd20.aidedCare: Aided Care (caregiver has 5 ranks in heal)

Use.Name: Use
Use.Info: Called when the item has been 'used' (attack, drink potion, etc.). Has the extra variable `attacks`, which is an array containing the action's attack rolls, if any.

Equip.Name: Equip
Equip.Info: Called when the item has been equipped or unequipped. Has the extra variable `equipped`, which is either `true` or `false`.

Toggle.Name: Toggle
Toggle.Info: Called when the item has been enabled or disabled. Has the extra variable `state`, which is either `true` or `false`.

ChangeQuantity.Name: Change Quantity
ChangeQuantity.Info: Called when the quantity of the item has been changed. Has the extra variables `quantity.previous` and `quantity.new`, which are both numbers.

ChangeLevel.Name: Change Level
ChangeLevel.Info: Called when the level of the item has been changed. Has the extra variables `quantity.previous` and `quantity.new`, which are both numbers.

FFd20.DeleteItemConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this item?
FFd20.UnsavedTinyMCE:
You have unsaved text in a field.
Would you like to save before closing?
FFd20.Name: Name
FFd20.ToggleSkillLock: Toggle edit lock on rarely needed parts of the skill list.
FFd20.SpellsTotalEachDay: Total spells each day (excluding free spells like domain and school spells)
FFd20.DomainSlotValueDesc: How many 'free' slots do Domain/School spells provide for a spell level?
FFd20.DisableLightLowLightVision: Disable Low-light Vision for Light Source
FFd20.CustomRollDesc: This roll uses a non-default formula
FFd20.Migration.Start: Applying FFd20 System Migration for version {version}. Please stand by.
FFd20.Migration.Ongoing: Migration is ongoing. Please wait until it finishes.
FFd20.Migration.End: FFd20 System Migration to version {version} succeeded!

FFd20.Info.AddClassDialog: You can hold Shift to bypass this dialog.
FFd20.Info.AddClassDialog_Desc: Pressing Normal opens a short wizard, while pressing Raw will add the class without any alterations.

FFd20.ErrorNoMPLeft: You don't have any MP left

FFd20.Help.Label: Help
FFd20.Help.WIP: This section is currently a Work In Progress (WIP).
FFd20.Help.Desc: This is a reference sheet and information panel on various topics of the Pathfinder 1e system for Foundry Virtual Tabletop.
FFd20.Help.Desc2: You can select topics on the left, whose contents will appear on the right. On the top of this window are navigational tools.

Formulas.Label: Formulas
Formulas.Desc: Formulas are an important aspect in the Pathfinder 1e system. They can be as simple as a single numerical value, or as complex as single lines of code. They play a great role in item changes.
Formulas.Desc2: For a quick reference, you can find a lot of this information in tooltips on actor sheets as well.

Variables.Label: Variables
Variables.Desc: Below you will find an (incomplete) list of variables you can use within your formulas.

AbilityScoreTotal.Desc: The total value of an ability score. Replace X with one of the following: 'str', 'dex', 'con', 'int', 'wis', 'cha'.

AbilityScoreMod.Desc: The modifier of an ability score. Replace X with one of the following: 'str', 'dex', 'con', 'int', 'wis', 'cha'.

HitDie.Desc: The total hit die the actor has. This is a combination of class levels and racial hit die, and it excludes mythic tiers.

SavingThrows.Desc: The total bonus of the appropriate saving throw for that actor. X can be either 'fort' (Fortitude), 'ref' (Reflex) or 'will' (Will)

SavingThrowsBase.Desc: The total base bonus of the appropriate saving throw for that actor, as given by class levels. X can be either 'fort' (Fortitude), 'ref' (Reflex) or 'will' (Will)

EncumbranceLevel.Desc: The current encumbrance level of the actor.

ArmorType.Desc: The type of armor the actor is wearing.

ShieldType.Desc: The type of shield the actor is holding.

CombatRound.Desc: The current round of combat, or 0 if not in combat.

CritMult.Desc: The critical multiplier of the attack, or 1 if the attack is not a critical threat. Only appropriate for use in damage rolls and attack and effect notes.

Functions.Label: Functions
Functions.Desc: The following are functions you can use within formulas, and examples on how to use them.

Max.Desc: Returns the highest of the given numbers.

Examples.0: Returns the either the actor's Strength modifier or the actor's Dexterity modifier, whichever is higher.

Min.Desc: Returns the lowest of the given numbers.

Examples.0: Returns the either the actor's Hit Die total or the number 10, whichever is lower.

Floor.Desc: Rounds the given number down to the lowest integer.

Examples.0: Returns half of the actor's Hit Die total, rounded down.

Ceil.Desc: Rounds the given number down to the highest integer.

Examples.0: Returns half of the actor's Hit Die total, rounded up.

Round.Desc: Rounds the given number to the nearest integer.

Examples.0: Returns one third of the actor's Hit Die total, rounded to the nearest whole number.

SquareRoot.Desc: Returns the positive square root of the given number.

Power.Desc: Returns x to the power of y.

SizeRoll.Desc: Alters a damage roll to that of another size category.

Examples.0: Rolls 1d8 for medium actors, and alters the damage formula according to the calling actor's current size.
Examples.1:
Translates a damage roll of 1d4 from a tiny actor (size '2') to a huge actor (size '6')
Output: 3d6

SizeReach.Desc: Generates a number equal to the reach of a creature of a certain size and stature.

Examples.0: Returns the normal melee reach as if the actor was 1 size category higher.
Examples.1: Returns the reach a huge, long actor would have with a reach weapon.

Hidden.Label: Hidden
Hidden.Description: Hidden compendiums will not show up for players in compendium browsers.

Disabled.Label: Disabled
Disabled.Description: Disabled compendiums will not show up for anyone (including GMs) in compendium browsers.

Generic.EnhancementBonusDesc: The item's enhancement bonus, as per the Core rules
Generic.MasterworkDesc: Whether the item is masterwork, as per the Core rules
Generic.BrokenDesc: Whether the item is broken, as per the Core rules
Generic.EquippedDesc: Whether the item is currently equipped, and transfers its changes to its actor (if any)
Generic.IdentifiedDesc: Whether the item is currently identified, and shows its identified information to players
Generic.SizeDesc: The item's size, similar to a character's size

Weapons.Label: Weapons
Weapons.Desc: Weapons are meant to represent physical weapons that a character can hold.
Weapons.CategoryDesc: The weapon's category (simple, martial, exotic or misc)
Weapons.TypeDesc: The weapon's type (light, one-handed, two-handed or ranged)
Weapons.SizeDesc: The weapon's size, similar to a character's size
Weapons.PropertiesDesc: The weapon's properties, as per the Core rules (does nothing mechanically)
Weapons.BonusAttackFormulaDesc: The weapon's attack bonus formula. Some examples:

BonusAttackFormulaExamples.0: Will incur a penalty to the attack roll of -2 if the wielder's Strength modifier is lower than 3

Weapons.BaseWeaponDamageDesc: The first field indicates the damage die a Medium-sized weapon would deal, and the second field indicates the type of damage it deals (i.e. Bludgeoning, Slashing, etc.)
Weapons.BonusDamageFormulaDesc: The bonus damage the weapon deals. Some examples:

BonusDamageFormulaExamples.0: Will add either 4 or the wielder's Strength modifier to the damage roll, whichever is lower

Weapons.BaseWeaponCriticalDesc: The first field indicates the lowest result of the attack's d20 to be a critical threat, and the second field indicates the amount by which the damage is multiplied

Equipment.Label: Equipment
Equipment.Desc: Equipment represents all non-weapon equippable items, including armor, shields, rings and wondrous items.
Equipment.CategoryDesc: The armor's category (whether it's armor, a shield, or something else)
Equipment.TypeDesc: Armor or Shield size type, or other item type (clothing, wondrous item, etc.)
Equipment.SlotDesc: What slot this item is for (only shows up for items other than armor or shields)
Equipment.StatusDesc: Status flags of this particular item

Consumables.Label: Consumables
Consumables.Desc: Consumables represent physical items with limited uses, such as potions or wands.

Containers.Label: Containers
Containers.Desc: Containers are items which can contain other items.

Loot.Label: Loot
Loot.Desc: Loot items are all types of physical items that don't fit in other major categories, such as trade goods and ammunition.

Description.Label: Description
Description.Name: Name
Description.NameDesc: The name of the item, if identified.
Description.UnidentifiedNameDesc: The name of the item, if unidentified. Shows the identified name for players if left empty.
Description.DescriptionDesc: The description to show, if identified.
Description.UnidentifiedDescriptionDesc: The description to show to players, if unidentified.
Description.PriceDesc: The price of the item, in gold pieces, if identified
Description.UnidentifiedPriceDesc: The price of the item, in gold pieces, if unidentified.

LoseDexToAC.Label: Lose Dex to AC
LoseDexToAC.Desc: While an item with this change is active, a character loses his Dexterity bonuses to Armor Class.

SetAbility.Label: X Ability
SetAbility.Desc: Sets the appropriate ability to the flag's specified value. This might be removed in a later version, since the same can be accomplished with the '=' operator (see below).

DwarfLikeEncumbrance.Label: Dwarf-like Encumbrance
DwarfLikeEncumbrance.Desc: While an item with this change is active, its actor will not be slowed down by being in a medium or heavy load.

FullSpeedMediumArmor.Label: Full Speed in Medium Armor
FullSpeedMediumArmor.Desc: While an item with this change is active, its actor will not be slowed down by wearing medium armor.

FullSpeedHeavyArmor.Label: Full Speed in Heavy Armor
FullSpeedHeavyArmor.Desc: While an item with this change is active, its actor will not be slowed down by wearing heavy armor.

Changes.Label: Changes
Changes.Desc: This is a list of changes which affect the actor owning the item directly. From left to right:

Formula.Label: Formula
Formula.Desc: The formula by which to affect this particular change. The way this alters an actor's attribute depends on the operator (see next). See {tagOpen}this page{tagClose} for more details.

Operator.Label: Operator
Operator.Desc: The operators are '+' (relative), '=' (absolute) or 'S' (script). Relative values add to an attribute, while absolute values set the attribute to the result of the formula. See below for the script operator.

Priority.Label: Priority
Priority.Desc: The priority of this change. Changes with lower priorities will be processed later.

Target.Label: Target
Target.Desc: A general category of the attribute to alter.

SubTarget.Label: Sub-Target
SubTarget.Desc: The specific attribute to alter with this change.

ContextNotes.Label: Context Notes
ContextNotes.Desc: This a list of contextual notes, which are shown in appropriate situations. From left to right:

Description.Label: Description
Description.Desc: The description to show in appropriate situations. Every newline adds a new description to the same target. You can use Foundry-style inline rolls in these.

Target.Label: Target
Target.Desc: A general category of the attribute to alter.

SubTarget.Label: Sub-Target
SubTarget.Desc: The specific attribute to alter with this change.

ScriptOperator.Label: Script Operator
ScriptOperator.Desc: The 'formula' of changes using the Script operator are actually small JavaScript scripts that are run when processing changes. Some JavaScript knowledge is required to understand these.

Variables.Desc: Within these scripts, the following variables can be used:

0.Name: d
0.Desc: The roll data at the time of processing the change. Contains any variable you could use within a normal change formula using the `@` symbol.

1.Name: result
1.Desc:
This contains two more variables, value and operator. Set value to the numeric result you want for the change, and operator to either "add" or "set".

value defaults to 0 and operator defaults to "add".

Desc.Basic: Flags can be used by modules and macros. Boolean Flags don't do anything by themselves, but Dictionary Flags can be used in rolls, in addition to their use in macros and modules.

DictionaryFlags.Basic: You can access Dictionary Flags within rolls by using @dFlags.(itemTag).(flagName), or with @item.dFlags.(flagName) within the current item.

Desc.Basic: Most items have certain categories of script calls, which are a combination of macros and inline scripts which run at specific events for that item.
In order to use Macros as Script Calls, simply drag a macro over from somewhere to the category of Script Calls you wish to run them on.
The variable availability differs somewhat from what's available in regular Macros. Below you will find a list of variables which are present within Script Calls.

Item.Desc: The item from which this event was called.

Actor.Desc: The actor which owns the calling item. Can be null if the item is not on an actor.

Token.Desc: The token of the associated actor, if any.

Shared.Desc: An object which starts out as empty, but is shared between all script calls of a single event, after which it is returned to the calling function, which may or may not do something with it.

Desc.Basic: Called when an item has been used. If an item has at least one script call under this category, it's usable no matter what. This call will have two additional variables: {var1} which is an array of attack data, and {var2}, which containts the attack's measure template (if any).
Desc.Extra1: Setting shared.hideChat to true prevents a chat card from being shown.
Desc.Extra2: Setting shared.reject to true prevents the item from being used, take away charges and showing a chat card.

Desc.Basic: Called when an item has been equipped or unequipped. This call will have an additional variable {var1} which is either true if it has just been equipped, or false if it has just been unequipped.
Called when a buff or feature has been toggled on/off. This call will have an additional variable {var1} which is either true if it has just been enabled or false if it has just been disabled.

Called when the quantity of a physical item has been changed. This call will have the additional variables {var1} and {var2}, which contains the quantity numbers before and after the update respectively.
Called when the level of a item has been changed. This call will have the additional variables {var1} and {var2}, which contains the numbers before and after the update respectively.

ITEM.TypeClass: Class, Racial HD, Mythic Path, etc.
